abstract: The government will convert  $5.5 billion of preferred stock into common shares, raising its equity stake in Ally to 74 percent.
snippet: The government will convert  $5.5 billion of preferred stock into common shares, raising its equity stake in Ally to 74 percent.
lead_paragraph: 7:50 p.m. | Updated The federal government said on Thursday that it was planning a complex transaction that would temporarily increase its ownership position in the former lending arm of General Motors to nearly three-fourths of the company while also paving the way to cash out its stake.

headline.main: U.S. Unveils Plan to Sell Stake in Ally, Once GMAC
